Wellness.Q: Do you sometimes feel fever, fatigue, shortness or breath, or nausea?
Wellness.A: Nope, I feel good most days, just sometimes tired if I play too much.

Wellness.Q: How many times do you usually eat a full meal in a day?
Wellness.A: I eat 3 meals, breakfast is my fav cuz I love pancakes!

Wellness.Q: How often do you wakeup throughout the night?
Wellness.A: I sleep like a log! Don't wake up till morning.

Wellness.Q: Do you normally feel very angry, sad, or anxious throughout the day?
Wellness.A: Not really, only when I have to clean my room. But I'm happy when I'm playing or watching cartoons.

Wellness.Q: How many days of the week are you active?
Wellness.A: I play outside almost every day except when it rains. So, like 5 or 6 days?

Extracurriculurs.Q: How do you feel about what you're being taught in school?
Extracurriculurs.A: School's cool, I guess. Math is hard but I like science, especially the experiments.

Extracurriculurs.Q: Do you feel safe during your daily activities?
Extracurriculurs.A: Yeah, I always stay where I can see my friends or teachers.

Extracurriculurs.Q: Do you have friends or classmates that you can spend time with throughout the day?
Extracurriculurs.A: Sure do! I have a best friend, and we do everything together at school.

Oncology.Q: How do you feel about your next doctor's appointment?
Oncology.A: I'm a bit scared but my mom says it's to make sure I'm healthy, so it's okay.

Oncology.Q: How do your at-home medicines make you feel?
Oncology.A: They're yucky but I feel stronger after I take them. Mom says they're like superpower juice.

Oncology.Q: How do you feel about your treatments?
Oncology.A: They make me tired but my doctor is nice and tells me jokes, so I feel a bit better.

Other.Q: On a scale of 1 to 10, how much pain would you say you have on a day-to-day basis?
Other.A: Like a 2? Only when I scrape my knee or something.

Other.Q: Is there anything else you want to share with your doctor?
Other.A: Can I have more lollipops when I visit?
